body.p:
To His Excellency
The Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned who are all citizens of Paducah Ky state that they are acquainted with Mrs L. J. Trowell who was fined at our last Court for permitting slave to go at large and trade for himself. The fine is $40. & costs. She is poor and since the Army has been here viz. 6th Sept 1861 she has been unable to control said slave who is a man and the meanest negro in Kentucky. She has all the while tried by warning and otherwise to keep persons from trading with him. Such was the evidence and such the facts in the case. Mrs Trowell was from home when case was tried and did not know of trial. The sheriff has the execution. We do think the case is entitled to Executive Clemency. --

G W Ratcliffe
